title.narrative: CROSS SECTORAL SUPPORT

description.narrative: Migrant Children and their families have access to life saving information to support and promote their protection and healthy behaviour, which contributes to Cross-Sectoral - Planning And Programme Reviews, Cross-Sectoral - Social And Behaviour Change, Cross-Sectoral - Social And Behaviour Change (Covid). UNICEF aims to achieve this through Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Operational Support To Programme Delivery. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Enhance capacity of national partners and stakeholders to protect children and adolescents affected by irregular migration and to recover from trauma and violence

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Migrant Children and their families have access to life saving information to support and promote their protection and healthybehaviour

description.narrative: In 2021, UNICEF ECA made investments to position social protection as part of the response in Trinidad and Tobago. This element amalgamates and enables a response that is more aligned and fit for purpose considering the impact of the COVID-19 pandemic.;UNICEF ECA also invested in strengthening its monitoring systems and in building the capacity of implementing partners for better reporting, evidence generation and analysis. | Status:Met | As-of Date:14/01/2022
